Statement: Severe winters restrict the growing season and only a single crop
Intensive subsistence agriculture is prevalent in the thickly populated areas of the monsoon regions of south, southeast and east Asia
Favourable topography of soil and climate are vital for agricultural activity in these areas
Transport, trade, banking, insurance and advertising are examples of tertiary activities
Maize is grown in North America, Brazil, China, Russia, Canada, India, and Mexico.
Tertiary activities provide support to the primary and secondary sectors through services.
Cotton, sugar, coffee and tea cane are the main crops of tea in Europe thus farming in plantation lands is a major activity in the world.
Climate with large number of days with sunshine and fertile soils permit crops of more than one season annually on the same plot.
In intensive urban agriculture the farmer cultivates a small plot of the land using simple seeds and more labour.
Nomadic hunting is practised in the semi-arid and arid regions of Sahara, Central Asia and some parts of India, like Rajasthan and Jammu and Kashmir.
